intro: Saccus dimorphophyllus, commonly known as the double-leaf saccus, is a unique aquatic plant belonging to the family Hydrocharitaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology, with two different leaf forms on the same plant—one floating and one submerged. The plant is native to freshwater habitats in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in Southeast Asia. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Saccus dimorphophyllus plays an important ecological role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and oxygen to water life.
